title: Ticket #4513: IPv6: ConvertDefaultIPToSocketIP always sets IPv4 address
description:
ConvertDefaultIPToSocketIP (/src/condor_utils/my_hostname.cpp around line 412) looks for the default IP address in a sinful and if present replaces it with the local IP address of the socket.

Problem 1: It's managing Sinfuls directly. It's got wonky code to try and detect the default address that is likely to fail for IPv6 addresses which might contain A-F which aren't is_digit(). If it decides to (erroneously) convert from IPv6 to IPv4, you'll end up with invalid entries like <[1.2.3.4]> (the square brackets are not valid). It should use the proper management tools.

Problem 2: It always returns an IPv4 address if both IPv4 and IPv6 are enabled. (Why is this? s.my_ip_str() would hopefully be an IPv6 address if we're establishing an IPv6 connection.)
remarks:
2014-Aug-06 10:29:16 by bbockelm:
Hi Alan,

my_ip_string() calls get_local_ipaddr() which is not protocol-aware and hence will return IPv4 (well, effectively does - might depend on just the sorting order).

It is fixed by this commit:

https://github.com/bbockelm/htcondor/commit/3837df2912a5342fc437effc5d4ea323f37dbb54

In that commit, I improve get_local_ipaddr() to be protocol aware (IPv6 or IPv4).

Brian
